channel.title: Basic Physics
channel.description:
I kind of wasn't paying attention in class. Someone answer this question for me?
A pulse of laser light takes 1.3 seconds to travel from the Moon to the Earth. The speed of light is approximately 3 x 10(to the power of 8) m/s (Metres)
How far away is the Moon from the Earth? Give your answer in km.
Also can you explain how it works? I feel so naughty for not listening :'(.

item.title: Basic Physics
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

Lol thanks… I feel stupid now.

Read full topic

item.title: Basic Physics
item.dc:creator: @Eh_Pretty_Easy Eh Pretty Easy
item.description:
@Eh_Pretty_Easy wrote:

Almost 390,000 km.

Speed of light/100*130 = 390,000 km.

???

Read full topic
